channel.title: Robert Raynor on Rayncloud.com
channel.description: Recent content in Robert Raynor on Rayncloud.com

item.title: Research
item.description: I am currently working with Prof. Sreeram Kannan, who is a visionary with respect to the role that modern decentralized information systems can play in improving societal equilibria. Our current research looks at the key barrier of trust bottlenecks which inhibit the efficient exchange of high quality data between those who can access/produce it and those who need it for a machine learning task. A key part of this research concerns using the combined discriminative power of a small validation set with the inductive bias of a well-selected model to valuate data from untrusted sources.

item.title: Why Deep Learning is Cool
item.description: Some thoughts about why deep learning is interesting.

item.title: Differential Privacy and Generalization
item.description: How differential privacy can be used to help solve problems of overfitting in adaptive data analysis.

item.title: Learning and Uniform Convergence
item.description: First post in a series on generalization in machine learning.

item.title: Plenoptic Camera Notes
item.description: Working notes related to the use of a plenoptic camera for estimating depth within a scene.
